page.title: 09BRISTOL WATERWORKS
page.content: { {CLEANING THE WATER First of all they pump the water into the {micro-strainer}which goes round and collects all the little bits. Then it goes underground to the tanks that have a metre of water, a metre of sand and some gravel. The sand collects other bits and after a while they have to scrape off the top layer of sand. They leave it for 3 or 4 months so that the trapped{organisms}will rot.Then they put the sand through a machine to clean it and to make it fine. After the water has gone through the sand and gravel it has {chlorine} pumped into it before it is stored in a tank.
